title: Newton's Third Law Application
description: In a rocket engine, Newton's Third Law explains the production of thrust. Which of the following best describes this application?

options.text: The exhaust gases pushing backwards cause an equal and opposite force pushing the rocket forwards
The rocket pushes against the air to move forward
The fuel combustion directly produces forward motion

title: Rocket Fuel Storage
description: Liquid hydrogen must be stored at extremely cold temperatures to maintain its liquid state.

title: Rocket Equation Variable
description: In the rocket equation, the symbol _____ represents the exhaust velocity.

title: Orbital Period
description: What happens to a satellite's orbital period when its orbital radius increases?

title: Kepler's Law
description: According to Kepler's _____ Law, planets sweep out equal areas in equal times.

title: Rocket Design Basic
description: The nose cone of a rocket is always perfectly pointed to minimize air resistance.
